result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Letter to Court dated September 8, 2022 - Defense asking for adjournment, filed by Atty. Miller

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 9, 2022 - APPROVED - Clerk to reschedule with parties.**
Second Amended Complaint
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:48 AM Defendant Tyler J Wright in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State filed a Second Amended Complaint.  Defense acknowledges receipt of second amended complaint, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Defesne reqeusts a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:57 AM Defendant Tyler J Wright in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are waiting for lab results.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:38 AM Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tyler J Wright in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  

The State has filed an amended complaint which amends this case to a misdemeanor.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Court sets matter before the Trial Court as a preliminary hearing is no longer needed due to all charges being misdemeanors.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:43 AM Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyler J Wright in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  Attorney Wittchow states there was a miscommunication and the officer was unavailable for today's date and the State is requesting an adjournment of the preliminary hearing.  Defense has no objection.  Court will adjourn for a preliminary hearing and notes time limits were previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
